title: Is Santa Officially Exempt from COVID-19 Restrictions in Ireland?
subtitle: It’s rumored that the North Pole resident is considered an essential worker with an “innate immunity” to the virus.
author: Madison Dapcevich
vclaim: Ireland Foreign Minister Simon Coveney declared in a Nov. 26, 2020, statement that Santa Claus is considered an essential worker, granting him exemption from self-quarantine to deliver Christmas presents.
